titles: A proclamation, discharging the importing of forraign linen, or woolen cloth, gold and silver threed, &c.
author: Scotland. Privy Council.
Scotland. Sovereign (1649-1685 : Charles II)
publisher: Printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, Printer to his most sacred Majesty,
notes: Royal arms at head of text; initial letter.
Dated: Given under Our Signet at Edinburgh, the first day of March, one thousand six hundred eighty and one, and of Our Raign, the thretty three year.
Signed: Pat. Menzies. Cl. Sti. Concilij.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
keywords: Textile industry --  Law and legislation --  Scotland --  Early works to 1800.
